titleStmt.title: Charles Gahres and Martha J. Gahres v. Isabella Sutton and W. H. Barrett. Martha J. Gahres being Sworn

publicationStmt.authority: Bring Me the Body: A Digital & Print History of Marginalized Habeas Corpus Petitioners in the North American West, 1804-1912

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Charles Gahres and Martha J. Gahres v. Isabella Sutton and W. H. Barrett. Martha J. Gahres being Sworn
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Eastern Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: Walla Walla County Government; Clerk, Territorial Court Civil/Criminal Case Files, 1860-1889

div1.p:
Territory of Washington
County of Walla Walla } ss
Martha J. Gahres being first duly sworn says that she is one of the plaitiffs in the above entitled action that she has heard the foregoing complaint read and believes the same to be true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 29 day of August A.D. 1873

In Dist. Court 1st Distr. Chs Gahres & Martha J. Gahres, Plfts
vs
W.H. Barret & Isabella Barret, Defts
J. H. Lasater & T.J. Audens Attys for Deft
In reading and due consideration of the written complaint it is ordered said the writ of Habeas Corpus issue in accordance therewith returnable on the 1st day of Sept 1873. at 1 oclock pm.
